qas.question: What are common side effects of Amphetamine?
What were some uses for Amphetamine?

answers.text: narcolepsy, post-encepheletic parkinsonism, and mood elevation in depression and other psychiatric indications

qas.question: Ephedrine was used as an oral medicine for what illness?
In what year was amphetamine first tested on asthma patients?
What was the trade name of amphetamine as a nasal decongestant?
In what year did the American Medical Association approve amphetamine for medical use?
In what decade were tricyclic antidepressants created?
What are common side effects of tricyclics?
When was the American Medical Association developed?

plausible_answers.text: narcolepsy, post-encepheletic parkinsonism, and mood elevation in depression and other psychiatric indications

qas.question: What were some uses for the American Medical Association?
Who synthesized the American Medical Association for asthma?

context: While highly effective, the requirement for injection limited the use of norepinephrine[clarification needed] and orally active derivatives were sought. A structurally similar compound, ephedrine, was identified by Japanese chemists in the Ma Huang plant and marketed by Eli Lilly as an oral treatment for <a5_0>asthma<a5_0/>. Following the work of Henry Dale and George Barger at Burroughs-Wellcome, academic chemist <a4_0><b14_0>Gordon Alles<b14_0/><a4_0/> synthesized amphetamine and tested it in asthma patients in <a6_0>1929<a6_0/>. The drug proved to have only modest anti-asthma effects, but produced <a1_0><b11_0>sensations of exhilaration and palpitations<b11_0/><a1_0/>. Amphetamine was developed by <a0_0><b10_0>Smith, Kline and French<b10_0/><a0_0/> as a nasal decongestant under the trade name <a7_0>Benzedrine Inhaler<a7_0/>. Amphetamine was eventually developed for the treatment of <a3_0><b13_0>narcolepsy, post-encepheletic parkinsonism, and mood elevation in depression and other psychiatric indications<b13_0/><a3_0/>. It received approval as a New and Nonofficial Remedy from the American Medical Association for these uses in <a8_0>1937<a8_0/> and remained in common use for depression until the development of tricyclic antidepressants in the <a2_0><a9_0><b12_0>1960s<b12_0/><a9_0/><a2_0/>.
